name: battery
definition: A container that stores chemical energy that can be converted into electricity and used as a source of power.

name: exhaustVAV
definition: A device that regulates the volume of air being exhausted out of a zone by opening or closing the damper.

name: oil
definition: A viscous liquid derived from petroleum, especially for use as a fuel or lubricant.

name: fumeHood
definition: A fume-collection device mounted over a work space, table, or shelf and serving to conduct unwanted gases away from the area enclosed.

name: limit
definition: A parameter that places a lower or upper bound on the range of permitted values of a Setpoint.

name: reset
definition: Indicates a boolean point that reset a flag, property or value to its default.

name: avg
definition: Average; central or typical value; median

name: building
definition:
A structure wholly or partially enclosed within exterior walls, or within exterior and party walls, and a roof, affording shelter to persons, animals, or property.
An independent unit of the built environment with a characteristic spatial structure, intended to serve at least one function or user activity [ISO 12006-2:2013]

name: charge
definition: Indicates electrical energy stored in a battery

name: co
definition: Carbon Monoxide level measured in ppm

name: coldDeck
definition: Duct carries air for cooling

name: communication
definition: Transmission of analog or digital signals over a wire or wirelessly.

name: compressor
definition: (1) device for mechanically increasing the pressure of a gas. (2) often described as being either open, hermetic, or semihermetic to describe how the compressor and motor drive is situated in relation to the gas or vapor being compressed. Types include centrifugal, axial flow, reciprocating, rotary screw, rotary vane, scroll, or diaphragm. 1. device for mechanically increasing the pressure of a gas. 2. specific machine, with or without accessories, for compressing refrigerant vapor.

name: deadband
definition: The range in a process where no changes to output are made. May also indicate the difference between a base setpoint and effective setpoint.

name: efficiency
definition: The ratio of useful work performed by an equipmen to the total energy consumed by the equipment

name: extent
definition: Applies to a point measuring the precentage of spread for a shade in a building.

name: failure
definition: Alarms that indicate the failure of devices, equipment, systems and control loops

name: fire
definition: Measures the presence of fire

name: flue
definition: Duct for exhausting combustion

name: heater
definition: A heater used to warm the air in an enclosed area, such as a room or office

name: high
definition: Indicates a degree that has crossed the upper threshold limit. Applied to alarm points

name: hotDeck
definition: Duct carries air for heating

name: illuminance
definition: Luminous flux hitting the inside of the sphere at a specific point

name: leak
definition: An alarm that indicates leaks occured in systems containing fluids

name: low
definition: Indicates a degree that has crossed the lower threshold limit. Applied to alarm points

name: maintenance
definition: An alarm that indicates that repair/maintenance is required on an associated device or equipment

name: motion
definition: Detects the presence of motion in some area

name: neutralVoltage
definition: Indicates voltage on the neutral line in a three phase connection

name: phase1
definition: Phase measurement in a three-phase electrical system

name: phase2
definition: Phase measurement in a three-phase electrical system

name: phase3
definition: Phase measurement in a three-phase electrical system

name: plantLoop
definition: Plant piping loop: primary, secondary, or tertiary

name: processWater
definition: Water used for a dedicated purpose such us heat or electricity generation or for a laboratory.

name: request
definition: Applies to a point indicating the count of heating or cooling requests made.

name: resistance
definition: Applies to a point measuring the opposition to the flow of electric current in a circuit. It is measured in Ohms

name: reverse
definition: Indicates the ability of a valve to change the direction of a refrigerant flow.

name: saturation
definition: Indicates the temperature at which a refrigerant changes state

name: condenserWater
definition: Water used used to remove heat through condensation

name: cooling
definition: Cooling mode or process

name: scene
definition: Indicates a binary point for switching on/off a preset lighting mode

name: domesticHotWaterPlant
definition: The equipment, devices and conduits that handle the production and distribution of domestic hot water in a building

name: collectionBasin
definition: An Area where water is transiently collected and directed to the sump or pump suction line, typically integral with a cooling tower

name: suction
definition: Applies to a point measuring pressure level at the intake of a compressor.

name: thermal
definition: Applies to a point measuring heat energy or power.

name: tilt
definition: Applies to a point measuring the precentage of slope for a shade in a building.

name: ventiltation
definition: Indicates a provision of fresh air into a zone.

name: tvoc
definition: Total volatile organic compound (TVOC).

name: cogen
definition: The equipment that generates heat and electricity at the same time. It is also called combined heat and power plant.

name: airDryer
definition: An equipment that removes water vapour concentrates inherent in a compressed air.

name: dryCooler
definition: An equipment that cools process liquids such as water or glycol mixtures.

name: humidifier
definition: An electrical device that is used to increaes the humidity level inside a zone.

name: shade
definition: A device used to control the amount of sunlight entering a building's interior zones. It helps in reducing energy consumption during summer and winter.

name: securityEquipment
definition: Various devices used to control and supervise the safety and secuirty of a building premises

name: fireSafetyEquipment
definition: Various devices intended to prevent ignition of an uncontrolled fire in building premises.

name: leakDetector
definition: A device that detects leaks occuring in systems with operational fluids.

name: sprayPump
definition: A pump used in spray evaporators

name: uvLighting
definition: Lighting equipment that controls UltraViolet light

name: weatherStation
definition: A dedicated weather measurement station

name: hydronicDuctHeater
definition: A duct heater that uses hot fluid to preheat the air being supplied to a room.

name: furnaceDuctHeater
definition: A duct heater that uses gas fired heating coils to preheat the air being supplied to a room.

name: dimmerControlledLighting
definition: Lighting group control module with brightness control.

name: sceneControlledLighting
definition: Lighting to control brightness with scene command.

name: photocellControlledLighting
definition: Lighting system photocell sensor.

name: fireControlPanel
definition: A panel-mounted device that provides status and control of a fire safety system

name: sweeperPump
definition: Pump used in cooling tower basing to clean debris and pollutants.

name: coolingTower
definition: Equipment to transfer waste heat into the atmosphere

name: vav
definition: A device that regulates the volume and temperature of air delivered to a zone by opening or closing a damper

name: coil
definition: Heat exchanger used to heat or cool air. Coils are sub-components of HVAC equipment such as ahu

name: elecMeter
definition: Equip or point which consumes energy as electrial load. Value should reference the meter it is associated with.

name: gasMeter
definition: Equip or point which consumes fuel gas as load. Value should reference the meter it is associated with.

name: steamMeter
definition: Equip or point which consumes steam as load. Value should reference the meter it is associated with.

name: waterMeter
definition: Equip or point which consumes water as load. Value should reference the meter it is associated with.

name: thermalMeter
definition: Equip which consumes thermal energy as load. Value should reference the meter it is associated with.

name: waterLoop
definition: A collection of equipment that transport and regulate water among each other

name: domesticWaterLoop
definition: A collection of equipment that transport and regulate domestic water among each other

name: hotWaterLoop
definition: A collection of equipment that transport and regulate hot water among each other

name: chilledWaterLoop
definition: A collection of equipment that transport and regulate chilled water among each other

name: boosterFan
definition: Fan activated to increase airflow beyond what is provided by the default configuration

name: coolingTowerFan
definition: A fan that pulls air through a cooling tower and across the louvers where the water falls to aid in heat exchange by the process of evaporation

name: chilledBeam
definition: Conditions a space using a heat exchanger integrated into the ceiling

name: condenserClosedLoop
definition: Working fluid is kept separate from fluid used for heat transfer into the atmosphere

name: condenserOpenLoop
definition: Uses working fluid itself for evaporation into the atmosphere

name: dxCooling
definition: Cooling using direct expansion of a refrigerant vapor

name: dxHeating
definition: Heating using direct expansion of a refrigerant vapor

name: oilHeat
definition: Indicates that a unit has heating capability using fossil fuel.

name: crac
definition: A device that monitors and maintains the temperature, air distribution and humidity in a network room or data center.

name: duct
definition: Conduit used to convey air for HVAC

name: exhaustFan
definition: Fan moving exhaust air;  air that must be removed from a space due to contaminants.

name: radiator
definition: Heats a space using exposed pipes or coils. Hot water and steam radiators are often cast iron and installed directly in the space or along the baseboard. Electric radiators are typically installed on the baseboard.

name: returnFan
definition: Fan moving return air; air that is circulated from the building back into the HVAC system.

name: rtu
definition: Packaged air conditioner mounted on a roof, the conditioned air being discharged directly into the rooms below or through a duct system.

name: chilledBeamZone
definition: AHU supplies air to chilled beam terminal units

name: multiZone
definition: AHU discharge air is split into a duct per zone

name: pressureDependent
definition: VAV damper modulates to control space temp; dependent on duct pressure being maintained

name: supplyFan
definition: Fan moving supply air;  air that is supplied from the HVAC system into the building.

name: pressureIndependent
definition: VAV damper modulates to control space temp; dependent on duct pressure being maintained

name: delta
definition: Differential of fluid between entering and leaving sensors.

name: effective
definition: Current control setpoint in effect taking into account other factors

name: radiantFloor
definition: Heats a space using pipes or cables embedded beneath floor.

name: primaryLoop
definition: Pipework which circulates closest to the energy source. In a central plant, the primary loop indicates the pipes and equipment within the central plant. In context of heat exchangers between the primary and secondary loops, this tag indicates the side closest to the plant.

name: secondaryLoop
definition: Pipework which circulates closest to the building or end use. In a central plant, the secondary loop indicates the pipes and equipment between the central plant and the building. In context of heat exchangers between the primary and secondary loops, this tag indicates the side closest to the building.

name: vavZone
definition: AHU supplies air to VAV terminal units

name: ahu
definition: Air Handling Unit: An enclosure with a fan that delivers air to a space via ductwork and performs one or more of the functions of cleaning, heating, cooling, humidifying, dehumidifying, ventilating or circulating the air.

name: boiler
definition: Equipment to generate hot water or steam for heating

name: bypass
definition: Pipe used to bypass an equipment

name: chilled
definition: Substance is cooled using cooling process

name: chiller
definition: Equipment to remove heat from a liquid. Chillers typically use a vapor compression or an absorption refrigeration cycle.

name: enable
definition: Secondary on/off point of an equip especially used with a vfd. Enable is used with Bool points where true indicates on and false indicates off. Equip with an enable should always also define a run point which indicates the primary on/off state of the equipment.

name: energy
definition: Measure of ability to do work

name: entering
definition: Pipe conveys fluid into an equipment

name: cmd
definition: Point is a command, actuator, AO/BO.

name: enum
definition:
Defines an eumeration of string key names. The range may also be applied to format a Bool ordered as 'false,true'. The string value of this tag may be formatted in one of four ways: dict of dicts keyed by name and Dict values for meta such as doc tag, comma separated names on one line, names separated by a '
' newline character, markdown unordered list formatted as a series of '- name: description
'. Enum names should follow valid tag naming rules (start with lowercase ASCII letter and contain only ASCII letters and numbers). However in cases where mapping directly to external enumerations enum names can contain arbitrary characters such as space.

name: evaporator
definition: Mechanism used to convert a refrigerant from its liquid to gaseous state.

name: fan
definition: Fan equipment or control point

name: fcu
definition: Fan Coil Unit: A unitary, factory-made enclosure with a fan and coil that recirculates air in a space and performs one or more of the functions of cleaning, heating, cooling, humidifying, dehumidifying, or ventilating the air. Unit heaters are examples of FCUs.

name: freezeStat
definition: A boolean point of an ahu indicating a freezing condition. This might require a control sequence to protect the equipment. If true then a freeze condition is detected, or false if not.

name: heat
definition: Associated with a heating process. When used on a point, this tag is associated with the control of heating.

name: heatExchanger
definition: Equipment to transfer heat between two working fluids.

name: heating
definition: Heating mode or process

name: heatPump
definition: Heat pump: An air handling equipment which employs a vapor compression cycle with a reversing valve to provide heating or cooling to a space.

name: heatWheel
definition: Boolean point indicating command state of AHU's heat wheel.

name: hot
definition: Having high degree of heat

name: isolation
definition: Actuator used to isolate an equipment from a pipe or ductwork system

name: leaving
definition: Pipe conveys fluid out of an equipment

name: mixed
definition: Duct where fresh outside air and return air is mixed together

name: mixing
definition: Three way valve which inputs two pipes and outputs a mixture between the two to a single output pipe.

name: occ
definition: Occupied mode of a space.

name: outside
definition: Duct to access fresh outside air for both ventilation and economizer.

name: pf
definition: Electrical power factor; unitless number between 0.0 and 1.0 which is ratio of active to apparent power in an AC power system.

name: pressure
definition: Measure of force applied

name: pump
definition: Pump equipment or control point

name: refrig
definition: Fluid used in refrigeration and heat exchange. Refrigerants typically alternate between liquid and gas state.

name: return
definition: Duct returning air back to equipment

name: run
definition: Primary on/off point of an equip especially used with a vfd. Run is used with Bool points where true indicates on and false indicates off. When paired with cmd this is the commanded state of the equipment. When paired with sensor this is the actual status of the equip. If the equipment also defines an enable point then both must be commanded on in order to run the equipment.

name: sensor
definition: Point is a sensor, input, AI/BI.

name: site
definition: Site is a geographic location of the built environment. Typically site maps to one building with its own unique street address.

name: sp
definition: Point is a setpoint, soft point, internal control variable, schedule.

name: stage
definition: Stage number of staged equipment operation such as coil or pump. The first stage is 1, second stage 2, etc.

name: standby
definition: Readiness mode of a space

name: tank
definition: Tank used to store a substance for temporary holding

name: unocc
definition: Unoccupied mode of a space.

name: valve
definition: Valve equipment or control point

name: wetBulb
definition: Wet bulb air temperature. Temperature which the air would have if cooled to saturation by the evaporation of water into it.

name: zone
definition: Related to spaces from a system perspective

name: directZone
definition: AHU supplies air directly to the zone

name: dualDuct
definition: Two ducts: combination of hotDeck, coldDeck, or neutralDeck

name: naturalGas
definition: Fossil fuel energy source consisting largely of methane and other hydrocarbons.

name: hvac
definition: Heating, ventilation, and air conditioning

name: cool
definition: Associated with low temperature or cooling processes. When used on a point, this tag is associated with the control of cooling. When paired with a substance, this tag indicates the substance is relatively cool in comparison to another substance, without being actively cooled by e.g. a chiller.

name: current
definition: Movement of fluid or electricity

name: elec
definition: Associated with electricity, electric charge

name: flow
definition: Measure of volumetric flow of fluid

name: humidity
definition: Percent relative humidity; measure of moisture in the air

name: level
definition: Range from 0% to 100%. When paired with a fluid this implies a fill level where 0% is empty and 100% is full.

name: power
definition: Energy consumed per unit time

name: steam
definition: Water in its gas form

name: temp
definition: Temperature - measure of hot and cold

name: total
definition: Complete or absolute

name: volt
definition: Electrical voltage, potential difference

name: chilledWaterPlant
definition: The equipment, devices and conduits that handle the production and distribution of chilled water in a building

name: hotWaterPlant
definition: The equipment, devices and conduits that handle the production and distribution of hot water in a building

name: vfd
definition: Electronic device that varies its output frequency to vary the rotating speed of a motor, given a fixed input frequency. Used with fans or pumps to vary the flow in the system as a function of a maintained pressure.

name: water
definition: Transparent, odorless, tasteless liquid; a compound of hydrogen and oxygen (H2O), containing 11.188% hydrogen and 88.812% oxygen by mass; freezing at 32F (0C); boiling near 212F (100C).

name: meter
definition: A device that measure usage or consumption of some media --- typically a form energy or power.

name: airCooling
definition: Cooling by dissipating heat into the surrounding air

name: chilledWaterCooling
definition: Cooling using transfer of heat to chilled water

name: constantAirVolume
definition: Delivers a constant volume of air flow. Typically this means equipment with a single speed fan.

name: coolingOnly
definition: Equipment without heating

name: elecHeating
definition: Heating by the conversion of electrical energy

name: naturalGasHeating
definition: Heating by the combustion of natural gas

name: hotWaterHeating
definition: Heating using energy of hot water

name: variableAirVolume
definition: Delivers a variable volume of air flow. Most variable volume systems are powered by a VFD fan. However other techniques such as inlet vanes may be used in older systems.

name: waterCooling
definition: Cooling using transfer of heat to water which is not explicitly chilled

name: dewPoint
definition: Dew point temperature at which water vapor will form dew

name: panel
definition: Enclosure for electrical and control equipment. Panels may be used to isolate electrical connections and provide environmental protection.

name: lighting
definition: Systems associated with illumination in the built environment

name: reheats
definition: Equipment heats a substance previously cooled or heated.

name: unitVent
definition: Unit Ventilator: An FCU that has direct access to outside air to provide the space with ventilation.

name: elevator
definition: Elevator refers to a vertical transportation machine that is used to move people or freight between levels or floors.

name: schedule
definition: Applied to a point indicating the planned occupancy of a conditioned space at a given time.

name: defrost
definition: Indicates a boolean point to remove frost or ice when the coil temperature drops below 32F.

name: linearVelocity
definition: Applied to a point measuring rate of change of position with respect to time

name: cav
definition: A terminal unit that delivers conditioned air to a zone. Unlike a VAV, the air volume remains constant in a CAV.

name: lockout
definition: A boolean point indicating a condition where the free rotation of a fan is stopped in unoccupied mode when there is no heating or cooling available

name: supply
definition: Associated with the air delivered from an ahu to downstream units such as VAVs.

name: discharge
definition: Associated with the air delivered from a unit directly into the zone.

name: virtual
definition: Refers to a point that has been calculated based on the combination of other points and is not directly observable.

name: alarm
definition: Applied to boolean points indicating a fault or failure condition

name: choke
definition: Indicates choke valve position. Applied to chilled/condenser water

name: dehumidify
definition: Indicates a boolean point to dehumidify (remove moisture) air.

name: dualTemp
definition: Applied to dual-temp water system.

name: duration
definition: Applied to points measuring the duration of an event.

name: dynamic
definition: Applied to points measuring dynamic pressure.

name: frequency
definition: Applied to vfd to measure output frequency.

name: glycol
definition: Point associated with the measurement or control of glycol.

name: humidify
definition: Indicates a boolean point to humidify (add moisture) air.

name: preCool
definition: Applied to coil points measuring discharge air temperature from a pre-cooling coil.

name: preHeat
definition: Applied to coil points measuring discharge air temperature from a pre-heating coil.

name: relief
definition: Associated with the relief air system to prevent over-pressurization in the conditioned space.

name: untagged
definition: Untagged refers to a Point Type/Equipment that is undentified or virtual.

name: ductHeater
definition: Duct Heaters are used to preheat the air being supplied to a room. Heat is created by passing electric current through resistance coils.

name: vrf
definition: Variable refrigerant Flow refers to an HVAC system that circulate refrigerant within the building to heat/cool spaces. As the name suggests, it operates at varying speeds reducing energy consumption.

name: mode
definition: Indicates the current state of an equipment or a system as an enumeration.

name: condenser
definition: Condensers are designed to transfer heat from one fluid to another. In HVAC systems condensers are used to cool refrigerant vapor into liquid.

name: enthalpy
definition: The total heat content of a system. It is the sum of the system's internal energy and product of it's pressure and volume.

name: gas
definition: Used on points measuring concentrations for gases other than Carbon Dioxide. E.g. NO2, CO

name: hotWaterReheat
definition: Indicates a VAV with hot water reheat.

name: parallel
definition: Indicates the VAV fan pulls air from outside the primary airflow.

name: series
definition: Indicates the VAV pulls air from the primary airflow.

name: singleDuct
definition: Indicates an ahu which uses a single duct for all air flow.

name: tripleDuct
definition: Indicates an ahu which discharges into three ducts which are the hotDeck, coldDeck, and neutralDeck.

name: elecReheat
definition: Indicates a VAV with electric reheat.

name: radiantEquip
definition: HVAC equipment that conditions a space without forced air.

name: erv
definition: Indicates an Energy Recovery Ventilation unit that harnesses the energy contained in exhausted air coming from a conditioned space and uses it to treat the incoming ventilated air.

name: glycolPump
definition: Pump designed to circulate glycol.

name: hotWaterBoiler
definition: Boiler that heats water below 100 C .It requires a pump to ciculate the hot water.

name: hotWaterPump
definition: Pump designed to ciculate hot water.

name: reliefFan
definition: Fan moving relief air to prevent over pressurization in the conditioned space.

name: steamBoiler
definition: Boiler that heats water at or above 100 C to convert it into steam.

name: absorptionChiller
definition: Indicates a chiller which uses absorption driven by hot water (as opposed to vapor compression).

name: centrifugalChiller
definition: Indicates chiller compressor which uses a continuous flow of fluid through an impeller.

name: circPump
definition: Pump designed to circulate a fluid through an equipment such as a boiler.

name: mau
definition: Used with ahu to mark an AHU as a makeup air handling unit which conditions 100% outside air, and no recirculated air.

name: chilledWaterPump
definition: Pump designed to circulate chilled water.

name: condenserWaterPump
definition: Pump designed to circulate condenser water.

name: domesticWaterPump
definition: Pump designed to circulate domestic water.

name: dualTempWaterPump
definition: Pump designed to circulate water in a dual temp water system.

name: reciprocalChiller
definition: Indicates chiller compressor which uses pistons driven by a crankshaft.

name: screwChiller
definition: Indicates chiller compressor which uses a rotary mechanism.

name: sitePanel
definition: Marker tag for an elecPanel to indicate its the main site-level panel.

name: subPanelOf
definition: Ref tag to indicate that an elecPanel is positioned underneath another panel in the electric distribution system.

name: air
definition: Point associated with the measurement or control of air.

name: apparent
definition: Applied to an electrical power point to indicate apparent power, typically measured in 'kVA'.

name: co2
definition: Carbon dioxide level point measured in ""ppm"".

name: damper
definition: Marker tag on point which indicates a damper used to regulate or control the flow or pressure of air.

name: active
definition: Applied to an electrical power point to indicate active power or real power, typically measured in 'kW'.

name: exhaust
definition: Associated with points measuring the flow of exhaust air

name: filter
definition: Differential pressure across the filter of an ahu. If a boolean point then true indicates successful airflow and false indicates a clogged filter. If a numeric point then the pressure differential should be measured in ""inH2O"" or ""kPa""

name: speed
definition: When used as a vfd point it is speed measured in ""%"" where 0% is off and 100% is the fastest speed.

name: makeup
definition: Points associated with the flow of makeup air; Outside air that replaces the exhausted air within the built environment

name: max
definition: Associated with a maximum value.

name: min
definition: Associated with a minumum value.

name: reactive
definition: Applied to an electrical power point to indicate reactive power or imaginary power, typically measured in 'kVAR'.
